title: TeraLab, A Secure Big Data Platform: Description And Use Cases

author: Franck Cotton, National Institute for Statistics and Economic Studies (INSEE)

segmentation: Yes, so I'm going to talk about the develop, which is a secure big data platform that we have just started to build.
And as you can guess from the title, there will be 2 parts.
1st I will briefly describe the platform and then I will mention 3 use cases of projects that are going to run on this big data platform.
So first of all, the description.
To start at the beginning.
In fact we in France we probably, as in most countries we have those big public funded research project and they are called for project in this programs.
And so we answered to one of those codes.
Generally, on in those calls you have different types of projects that are submitted.

Some projects are for using big data in different sectors, for example, and other projects are for building actual real physical platforms to run the project, and the second type of project the platform projects.
That's where we submitted the proposal and it was accepted.

When I say we it's a consortium which is, which is comprising two groups of higher education engineering schools in France so that the IMT which is a group of about 15 schools engineering in industry or telecommunications.
And there's Genesis which is a group of schools, high schools on statistics, economy, finance etc.
And then say the French National Statistical Institute is a partner of this project.
So the project as I said, was launched, selected launch.
The budget is 5.7 million euros.
It runs on five years and it's just been started because we signed the contract in December.
So the aim of the project is to build this secure big data platform on which the other projects will run.
So just a brief description of this platform you have at the lower level you have a state of the art technical infrastructure.
I won't go into the details here, but you have a big server with very big memory, very high number of processors and you have also a distributed system, a cluster, etc.
What is important here is that security data protection, data privacy privacy was incorporated in the design of the platform so secure that the platform is some interesting security figures features.
Over this platform you have a rich catalogue of software tools for storage of data for querying the data, exploring the data, visualizing the data etc etc.
And you also have of course set of tools to manage the platform to monitor the platform to monitor the projects, etc.
3rd aspects of this platform.
You have data sets which are pre installed on the platform so they can be used by the project so so we have public data.
Open data for example in say we publish a lot of open data.
We publish most of our data is open so we can put it on the platform pre install it on the platform.

You can also have open source data like Open St Maps or common Crawl or things like that that are preinstalled on the platform and the project that will be using the platform will come with their data data from telecommunication operators.
For example data from Twitter Facebook, anything.
So we have some datasets installed on the platform and most important we also have a dedicated team to run the platform to conceive the platform first of all to run it.
To operate it and to advise the projects that will be using the platform.
For example, to qualify the project to help them configure the tools that they will be using to help them decide what data they will be using to support them when running the project etc etc.
So that six people which are 100% dedicated to the platform.
So that's quite quite important.
This is a figure which describes the overall organization of the platform and that's when you begin to see how security is implemented in the platform.
In fact, you have two.
Compartment in the platform.
One of them is on the left.
There has a big cluster of servers and also a big server with a lot.
A lot of memory.
I mentioned some figures for some.
For those of you who are into figures, but that's a huge server.
And.
That's accessed by usual desktop, virtual machine etc and the other component which is on the right is a very ultra secure area.
I will detail how you can access these this area in the next slide, but it needs you need a special device to accept to access this area.
It's very, very secure and you can't access it with the usual desktop and in this very secure area you have a cluster.
Another cluster smaller than this one, but still quite big.
And this one on the right is operated by the CSD.
So the center, so secure remote access data center, which camel is a president of and this one on the left is more operated by the EMT.
The other partner in the project.
So we're going to concentrate on the right part of the figures.
First of all, a few words about the CSC ASD.
So it is the Center for researcher.
It contains extremely detailed confidential data, for example, individual data that we instead produce are there.
It contains data about justice about fiscal data, about health, data, well, very highly sensitive data, and it's very, very secure at the central.
At the center of the CSD.
What we call the bubble, which is really what its name means.
Completely impermeable, you can't access it other than by a specific device which is called the SD box and the use of the books guarantees the completing permeability of the bubble.
So we suggest the box the researchers may access the data.
They can work remotely from their institutions, for example, on the confidential data.
And they can request output when they have done their job, their studies.
They can request output.
They can even request to input some programs or some data to compare with the confidential data.
But every thing every program, every data that comes in or comes out of the CSD of the bubble is monitored by a human.
So it's it's really a secure device.

And so that the owners are really sure that the authorized researcher, the guy behind you has the box, is the authorized researcher, because as the box itself is very secure, there is a smart card with the high quality certificate with face to face enrollment.
There is a biometric device, so it's very secure.
An that owner is also sure that this data is safe inside the bubble because no data can come out without being monitored.
You can't paste or copy, you can't insert USB keys etc etc.
So it's quite so.
Well, that's a photo of the of the SD box.
If you want to buy one you can you can.
You can ask me know.
That's the the schema of this here.
Yes, these you see the bubble is is is down there and you can access either from the local network if you're in business for example in the group of schools using this facility.
Or you can access through the Internet through VPN on SSL so you can do this.
Researchers, for example can be in other countries we have cases of researchers from other countries accessing the CSD.
But now if the.
With that error project we are going to insert this highly secure component.
Highly secure cluster that I mentioned in the previous slides inside the bubble of the CSD and so.
The researchers will be able to use first of all big data, big confidential data, and to use software to mention some of the software here.
But to use the data to analyze the data etc etc.
Before going to the use, cases are just a few words about the planning high.
My young times five OK.
So I can you can read it.
I'm going to pass on this one I'm going to.
I want to talk about the use cases we have already.
Some use cases of course.

For example, the projects that I mentioned at the beginning which were selected in the same core for project that ourselves they are already in contact with us because they want to run their projects.
But I will mention three specific use cases which are quite interesting which are not part of those projects.
First one is use cases in public statistics.
Publix, well, big data and public statistics.
Big well hot subject very hot topic.
Well, no big data is hot, but big data is public.
Statistic is hotter.
You have for example all the international organization we have used that here.
They are very, very excited about that.
Your studies organizing task forces.
We said the organizing an event at the at the end of this month.
So everybody is doing well.
He's talking about big data.
In public statistics.
There are some experiences, for example, in Estonia has done something.
the Netherlands have done some things that we know of, but mostly they're talking about that.
It's it's a bit like teenage sex.
You know, everybody's talking about it, but we're not sure somebody has actually done it.
How can tell abuse?
Bring some service here.
Well, the statisticians.
In fact, though they're quite at a loss because they see all these big data and it's like they found a new continent.
You know it's a low data data, but in fact the problem was mentioned in by Steven this morning is that it's not the usual statistical data.
The statisticians, when they have a problem, they designed the model, they select the population.
The select example in the population they run the survey, and then we have the data which correspond to the model.
But now.

They have the data and they have to find the models inside the data because the data first of all belongs to somebody else and has been collected in a purpose which is which they have no control about.
So it's really just a change of perspective for the statisticians and the problem of this statisticians is merely is mostly a mythological problem, so they want to test.
They want to test new methods on how to use this data.
We want to know how to combine.
This.
Data which will beat wild with their data, which are very well behaving.
So how do you combine those structured data and big data?
For example?
That's one problem.
Well, Terrell, up is the occasion to actually do something.
And to actually test, do some metric tests for statistical for public statistics.
So we have some very precise project on the on this subject.
One of them is going to use the platform in September.
It's about using scanner data for the calculation of the Consumer price index.
They have been doing some methodological studies for sometimes now and they're ready to use the big data platform to see if it really brings something to them.
If it brings new functionalities.
But we have.
Also, we expect a lot of ideas from the statistical community.
For example, in the domains of transport energy.
Tourism, well, social science etc.
2nd.
Case that I'm going to to mention, it's health data, so we had this morning we had before description of the British Health System Information System.
Well ours is bigger.
Yes, probably because we consume more medicine, but so we have really really huge health data and.

This of course is highly highly sensitive data and Terrell up can fit in in response to this problematic because it can meet the challenges of dealing with high volumes and dealing with real time analysis because sometimes you need real time analysis on health data when you have a problem in the public health for example, and it can also ensure that you apply ultra high security to the data, so that's the second case.
And third case.
That I want.
Oops, sorry.
If I wanted, well, no field case because I'm late so.
Include.
Where are we now?
The story is just begun.
The planning is very tight.
We are building the platform on the very tight schedule.
We have a better version of the cluster.
The distributed service opening next month we have the big Big server which will be put in service in summer.
And we have the Ultra secure compartment, the one with which was on the right there opening in September.
The team is being set up currently.
We have identified projects that will be running and well.
Contact us if you have a big data project.
We're not restricted to French project or if you are a software vendor, you want to give us your software and visit our website.
Thank you.
Thank you very much.
